Package application.managers

Class CredentialsManager

java.lang.Object
application.managers.CredentialsManager
public class CredentialsManager extends Object
This class deals with the management of accesses and registrations.
Author:
Federico Canali

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static CredentialsManager getInstance()
      The constructor is called only if the static instance is null, so only the first time that the getInstance() method is invoked. All the other times the same instance object is returned.
      Returns:
      the instance object is returned.

    • getTypeOfPersonLoggedIn

      public int getTypeOfPersonLoggedIn()
      Returns the type of user who is currently logged on.
      Returns:
      the type of user who is logged in is returned.

    • getUsernameLoggedIn

      public String getUsernameLoggedIn()
      Returns the user name who is currently logged on.
      Returns:
      Returns the user name who is currently logged on.

    • signUp

      public boolean signUp(Person person)
      Used to sign up new user.
      Parameters:
      person - person to register.
      Returns:
      This method returns true if registration is successful, otherwise false.

    • logIn

      public boolean logIn(String username, String password)
      Used to log in with credentials.
      Parameters:
      username - is the username of the user trying to connect.
      password - is the password of the user trying to connect.
      Returns:
      This method returns true if access is successful, otherwise false.

    • getTypeOfUser

      public String getTypeOfUser()
      Used to get the type of user logged on.
      Returns:
      This method returns the type of connected user in string. If none linked, it returns null.

    • printAllPeople

      public void printAllPeople()
      Used to print to console all people registered

    • addNewEmployee

      public boolean addNewEmployee(String name, String lastName, String username, String password)
      This method is used to add a new employee by entering all data from the console.
      Parameters:
      name - represents the name of new employee.
      lastName - represents the surname of new employee.
      username - represents the username of new employee.
      password - represents the password of new employee.
      Returns:
      This method returns true if access is successful, otherwise false.

    • getAllEmployee

      public List<Employee> getAllEmployee()
      This method is used to get all registered employees and print them to console.
      Returns:
      Returns the list of all employee

    • logout

      public void logout()
      This method is used to log out.
